casebody.data:
Dauchy and others vs. Taylor. The venue in this case was laid in the county of Essex. The plaintiffs reside in New York, where it was admitted, the cause of action, which was of a transitory nature, arose. Upon hearing an affidavit of the defendant, stating that he resides in the county of Gloucester, that the process issued in this case was served upon him in that county, and that the witnesses material for his defence also reside there, the court ordered the venue to be changed to tho latter county. Sloan, for the defendant.

CHANGE OF VENUE.

Gifford, for the plaintiffs.
